tool.name: WwaToPorts

param.name: wwa_fcs
param.dialogReference:
The Watch/Warning polygon feature class(es) to be associated with the port locations.

Annual archived shapefiles can be downloaded fromm Iowa State University Iowa Environmental Mesonet (IEM) site for your years of interest. https://mesonet.agron.iastate.edu/request/gis/watchwarn.phtml

It is recommended to filter these data prior to running this tool to include only the phenomena of interest.

param.name: port_fc
param.dialogReference:
The feature class with the port locations.

Each port must have a unique identifier

param.name: dist_unit
param.displayname: Maximum Distance from Port to Associate Watches/Warnings
param.dialogReference:
The maximum distance (with units) from the port location to associate a weather warning/watch event. The distance you choose will depend on how localized the weather event is expected to have an impact on fishing behavior.

It is recommended to use a planar distance unit (i.e., anything but Decimal degrees or Unknown).

param.name: out_file
param.dialogReference:
The output csv file which will contain a row for each watch/warning event associated with each port.

All attributes from the port and watch/warning data are included.

There will be multiple entries for a single port because each port will likely have multiple watch/warning events within the specified distance.

tool.summary: This tool will perform a spatial join between Port locations and National Weather Service Watch and Warning (wwa) polygons given a specified maximum distance from each port. Output is a csv file of the ports and the associated weather events.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool will perform a spatial join between Port locations and National Weather Service Watch and Warning (wwa) polygons given a specified maximum distance from each port. Output is a csv file of the ports and the associated weather events.
